results.description:
(***MEN AND WOMEN ARE WELCOME***) 

Take A Risk SEX is an experiential event where you take a risk to share and explore an aspect of your sexuality . 

When we experience ourselves as sexual beings, open to our full flow, pulsing with life energy through our body, we become more creative and feel more deeply connected to ourselves and to others. In this dynamic, interactive evening combining individual work with group process, you will learn techniques to liberate this energy and access more pleasure in your life. These techniques will be demonstrated through individual body readings with select participants who choose to take the risk of revealing a sexual issue and are willing to work through it in a supportive environment with expert guidance. 

Dr. Kincaid uses the teachings of Integral Evolutionary Tantra and the principles of Core Energetics to open up physical blocks and places where life energy doesn’t move. In Integral Evolutionary Tantric teachings and in Core Energetics -- a powerful body-based process -- sexual energy and life force energy are one and the same. Join us with body readings, deep truth, wild goodness, radical personal transformation and, if you dare, the evolution of your own personal enlightenment.


Led by Kristina Kincaid in conjunction with

The Institute of The Integral Evolutionary Tantra

Assisted by Tara Urszula Pietrzykowska and Cynthia Kagoshima

Saturday Oct 10th,[masked]:00~9:00 PM

150 West 28th Street Ste 1803New York, NY 10001

Admission: $20 

Tickets: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/take-a-risk-sex-with-dr-kristina-kincaid-tickets-18716768358

Dr. Kristina Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.
results.name: Take A Risk: SEX! with Dr. Kristina Kincaid

results.description: This is a party for linguists only. If you are currently working on learning a language, you're a linguist, so by all means come! Everybody needs to bring one item, either a drink or snack, and if you can, please bring something related to the language you are learning (Spanish snack/drink for Spanish learners). The party will consist of music, food, drinks (including a little beer/wine but there's no pressure to drink), and some fun cultural games. There will be cool people at this party for you to meet, including me. When you've signed up, I will confirm by sending you the address. Hope to see you there!
results.name: Potluck Party for Linguists Only

results.description:
Let's go see The Martian at the Alamo DraftHouse on Saturday Oct 10th - for the 7:15 pm showing. This film has been getting great buzz and i want to see it -- and thought others might want to also. We'll go to Alamo so we can have dinner and drinks while we watch the movie, too! 

If you're not into seeing the Martian there are other films around the same time as well -- check on their website to learn more -- https://drafthouse.com/nyc-area/theater/yonkers

Get ready to be blown away. THE MARTIAN starring Matt Damon, Jessica Chastain, Chiwetel Ejiofor and Kristen Wiig with a special screening of the upcoming film directed by Ridley Scott. THE MARTIAN is the story of what happens during a manned mission to Mars, when Astronaut Mark Watney is presumed dead after a fierce storm and left behind by his crew. But Watney has survived and finds himself stranded and alone on the hostile planet. With only meager supplies, he must draw upon his ingenuity, wit and spirit to subsist and find a way to signal to Earth that he is alive. Millions of miles away, NASA and a team of international scientists work tirelessly to bring “the Martian” home, while his crewmates concurrently plot a daring, if not impossible rescue mission.


Please buy your tickets in advance, so we can all sit together.. and arrive by 6:45 so we can order dinner and drinks..  I bought ROW 3 Seat 13 for the 7:15 show.. 

Hope to see  you there!
results.how_to_find_us: Please meet us in the lobby - purchase your tickets in advance so we can sit together!
results.name: Let's go see The Martian at the Alamo Drafthouse - Yonkers!

group.name: Cheap Eats and other foodie delights of Westchester

results.description:
A special public lecture and stargazing event at William Paterson University


Saturday, October 10, 7:30 PM - 11:30 PM.
Science Hall East, Room 2064, WPU
Free and open to the general public
Stargazing hotline: [masked]

http://www.wpunj.edu/cosh/departments/physics/news-and-events.dot

Details:


Come out for a great evening of stargazing fun with William Paterson University. Then, we'll have a public lecture on the search for life in the universe. Prof. Jason Kendall of WPU's Physics Department will talk about astronomers' search for life on other planets, including Mars, Titan, Enceladus and beyond! Following the talk, we'll take a walk out to the Wightman Football Field to go stargazing. You'll be able to see stars and nebulae through a telescope! If it's clear, it'll be third-quarter Moon, giving us a wonderful view of the wonders of the sky. The telescopes will be operated by Prof. Kendall's Introduction to Astronomy class. They've been working hard all semester learning the skies and and are ready to be your Star Ambassadors. In the event of a cloudy or rainy night, we'll follow the lecture with a 45-minute movie. Please also make sure to call the hotline, because the stargazing event will be changed to a movie in the event of clouds or rain. Local area amateur astronomers are invited to bring their telescopes. Kids and families are welcome. This event is hosted by the faculty of the Physics Department of William Paterson University. 

“Searching for Life Out There in the Universe”

Throughout time, mankind has looked into the heavens and wondered if we were alone in the universe. Now, we are starting to take the first steps to understanding whether or not our wildest dreams are true. Whether it's flowing water on Mars, or salty jets on Enceladus, or even potential methane-based life on cold Titan, evidence is just now beginning to come in. The SETI team continually searches for signals from space, and the Kepler Space Telescope has found evidence for thousands of Earth-sized worlds, with the first potential Earth-2.0 found this year. It's an exciting time to search for E.T.!

About Jason Kendall

Jason Kendall teaches Astronomy at William Paterson University. He's been seen on The Weather Channel's “Wake Up With Al” for a monthly segment on astronomy and stargazing. He's also been seen on CBS NY, FOX5 NY, and on WNYC radio. He's given public lectures and events all over NJ, NY, PA, CT, with featured speaking engagements at the Hayden Planetarium, Columbia University, The Cherry Springs Star Party, The Explorers Club, the Wayne YMCA, the United Astronomy Clubs of New Jersey and numerous other venues. He leads the metro area as a public speaker on astronomy engaging both the young and the experienced on all areas from black holes to the Big Bang. More information and booking at www.jasonkendall.com

Parking:

Please use Lot #2, which is right next to the Wightman Football Field. There will be signs from Pompton Road, to turn north onto Mills Drive. Park in Lot #2 and walk up to the football field. The stargazing event will be on the track in front of the home seats. The public lecture is in Science Hall East.

Hotline:

Since stargazing depends upon clear nights, if it cloudy or rainy, we'll cancel the outdoor program. Please call the event hotline above for updates about whether or not we'll be stargazing.
​
results.how_to_find_us: It's a small place, look for the guy with the bow tie.
results.name: A Public Lecture by Jason Kendall: "Searching for Life Out in the Universe"

results.description:
Join multiple meetup groups as we casually stroll through Astoria ending at Astoria Flea and Food Night Market. Every 6 to 10 minutes (depending on the size of the group) I ask the men to switch with a woman they have not spoken with until everyone has spoken with everyone. Check out the photos from one of our previous Astoria walks. It was a great turnout and we had an awesome time! 

Afterwards, we'll check out Astoria Flea and Food at Kaufman Studios. Click this link to see more info on Astoria Flea and Food Night Market. 

We'll meet at 6:30 PM in front of the McDonald's which is located at at the last stop of the N/Q line in Astoria. When you get out, look for the McDonald's and those gorgeous people standing there will be us.  

The walk will start at EXACTLY 7 PM. If you are late, you will miss us. Do not be late.

Pace/Distance/Duration: The pace of this walk will be easy-going. The total distance is a little over 1.5 miles. It shouldn't take more than 45 minutes from start to finish. 

How will you find us? Look for the group of people standing in front of McDonald's at the last stop of the N/Q line (Ditmars Blvd) and then look for the tallest guy there. That will be Beau, your Date Walk organizer. Alternatively, if you do not like approaching a massive group of strangers, you can CALL the organizer at [masked] 

What to expect? Date Walks are very casual and easy-to-attend / non-awkward + the host Beau is always there to make introductions. It’s really easy to meet people. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed to a future date.

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call.

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 

Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook­ | Twitter­
results.name: Astoria Singles Walk + Night Market - Age 21 to 49

It's time to learn Michael Jackson's legendary "Thriller" dance for THRILL DAY. Zombies from the Tri-state area will be joining us on Saturday, October 24th from 2pm-6pm with the main THRILLER dance to be held world-wide at 5pm.

This class is for all those participants who already Pre-registered for THRILL DAY. You must be registered for the event to join this class. To do so visit https://www.eventbrite.com/e/thrill-the-world-nyc-zombie-masquerade-ball-tickets-16927870717

YouTube videos to learn the dance are located on our website: http://thrilltheworldnyc.com/ttw-thriller-dance

The podcast to memorize the dance steps: http://www.thrilltheworldnyc.com/learn_thriller.zip

Please don't forget that we will be holding a www.pajamaprogram.com drive on Saturday, October 24th where you can bring a pair of pajamas or new children's book. 

Thank you so much for joining us!

See you in class!

Amada aka Mama Zombie and the TTWNYC Staff

results.description:
Internationally recognized as among the great exponents of Hindustani classical music, Pandit Ramesh Misra (sarangi) and Pandit Samar Saha (tabla) have been close collaborators for decades, developing a musical rapport of intuition and subtle communication. While possessing deep technical mastery, the maestros opt for beauty over virtuosity, tailoring their melodic and rhythmic creations to the present moment and unfolding a unique musical presentation in each performance.

http://rubinmuseum.org/events/event/samar-saha-ramesh-misra-10-10-2015

This can be used online, at the front desk, or by calling/emailing the box office [masked] x344/ [masked])

Presented with Harrice Miller Entertainment and community partner Sunny Thakkar.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$27- PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.
results.name: Speeddating Ages 30-42 - 2M/2F SPOTS LEFT

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour, topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates." You'll meet each member of the opposite sex for 5-7 minutes each (depending on the size of the event - EXPECT TO MEET 7 TO 12 MEMBERS OF THE OPPOSITE SEX*), turn in your dating card and then we'll send you the contact info of your mutual matches 48 hours later. On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

$5 Draft Beers, House Wine, Well Mixed Drink


PAYMENT POLICY:
$27 - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2015atwysspeeddatingnyc.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS


~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*You will have approximately 8-12 dates.*

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds. Speed rounds last 5 minutes each.

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's 1 or 2 more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. We will NOT host an event if there isn't AT LEAST 7 of each gender registered, and we will NOT let there be an excessive (more than 3) amount of one gender versus the other.

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Okay, we all know a lot of exceptional people. Some of them happen to be single. And a lot of us are always complaining about how we never meet anyone decent to date. Let's get together and do what works when it comes to dating -- meeting people through friends and seeing immediately if there's chemistry.

Our fantastic EWNYC members will review all the great single friends we know and invite a few of them to join us for an evening of fun. Doesn't matter who they are, there is only one criteria that they need and that's to be completely single. The great thing is that these are people whose 100% awesomeness can be vouched for -- none of us are friends with serial killers, right? It's not mandatory but you should probably be single also, you might make a connection here of your own.

The Rules ...

In order to keep the ratio of the sexes somewhat even, we do not want to discourage members from attending if they do not have a friend to come with. For example, if your friends, coworker, gym buddy and lunch mate is busy simply come. Will be your single friend

There are no age restrictions regarding the friends you can bring. EWNYC has members of all ages and who are we to stand in the way of the blossoming of a May-December romance.

If you would like to attend you cannot bring a friend you must come alone. Please contact the organizer. We are a friendly group and enjoy the time in this intimate setting. The organizer needs a single friend (contact her she is on the rsvp list)

A list will be created of all attendees so when RSVP'ing. If you are not able to attend, change your rsvp and do not keep others from attending

Spread The Word ...

I emailed the idea for this event to a few select friends and you would be amazed at how many liked the idea and would like to attend. Start talking to the single people you know and I'm sure you'll get a bunch of enthusiastic responses.

 

Best Regards

EWNYC
results.name: Bring a Single Friend Event

results.description:
Ever found a hidden spot in the big metropolitan city and claimed ownership of the space? If not, then you've definitely missed out spotting this underground secrete ramen joint : Bassanova!

Within the heart of Chinatown, basement level, opens a small boutique ramen shop, only serving a well balanced broth served on authentic japanese noodle. 

Stepping into the store is like a transcendence. An unnatural displacement from the Chinatown grungy to Tokyo clean. Rated top 10 hidden restaurants in NYC, serving confidently 3 choices of ramen only, they have rapidly reached 4/5 star on Yelp.com

That's enough reason to go there and try it out!

COST: $15-$20 bucks tops!

results.description:
Club 412's "Saturday Night Special" Dance Party

"Club 412" has three rooms of music, great sound, beautiful hard wood floors and a cash bar. The "Club" is known for it's friendly staff and patrons. Come out and join us and be welcomed into the "family"!

Our event will kick off at with the 8pm Pre-Party Dance Lesson in your choice of rooms: Hustle, Latin and Ballroom. Then the DJ's take over and "get our groove on" till 1am. It's really fun to roam from room to room to see what everybody's doing and enjoy the different music.

Hey you NEWBIES to dancing, come on down! The Pre-Party Class is your launch pad to an evening of FUN. It's a great opportunity to meet new people and expand your dancing skills.

For you EXPERIENCED DANCERS, there will be plenty of partners of all levels! People from Manhattan, Long Island, New Jersey and Connecticut all flock to this event. There will be over 150 people, READY TO DANCE the night away.

Club 412 is located at 412 8th Ave, at 31st St., 4th floor
(1 block South of Penn Station/MSG)
$15 Admission includes choice of free class 8-9p. Print this page & get $2 discount

*To enter building, Press 4 then 'CALL' on the intercom*

group.name: The New York Ballroom Dance Meetup

results.description:
NOTE: This Meet Up is being hosted by several different groups.  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.

The New York Social Network (NYSN) has been planning events in and around the city since 2004!  There is something to choose from almost every night and several options each weekend!  It can be hard to figure out which ones may be best for you, especially if you have never been out before.

If you are new to the group or a long time member, this is a fun night to meet others and find out what what we have planned in the coming months. NYSN founder Dave Cervini will be on hand with our staff to welcome all New Members and introduce you to our long time members.  You will enjoy drink specials,  complimentary hot and cold appetizers and lot's of room to socialize network and connect.

The World Bar is a nice lounge with lot's of room to sit or wander around while meeting others.

Other Meet Up and Social Networking groups/organizations often invite their members so you also get to network with people from similar groups.

The night will include:

-complimentary hot and cold appetizers until 9pm

-Drink specials until 9pm

-Music played at conversational levels

Can I come alone? Yes, 95% of those attending tend to come on their own.

What to expect: 60-80 people fairly even split of men and women ages 20's -40's, singles and some couples. Most are there to network and connect.

Why does the event organizer have +40 for his RSVP's? That is because there are 8 Meetup.com groups and www.newyorksocialnetwork.com promoting this event.  There will be many more people than what you see below attending.

What to wear: trendy, neat, business casual

How do I get there? take any of the green line trains to 42nd Grand Central or 51st street. Then a short walk towards the East River

How long does it go?  We usually start breaking up around 12:30-1am.

General Admission is $5.00.  Please bring exact change to the door.

This event is being sponsored by The New York Social Network which is a collaboration of several different Meet Up Groups (

www.newyorksocialnetwork.com

).  The number of RSVP's below reflect only a portion of those attending.  Please only sign up for this event if you are serious about attending.  We have a 3 flakes and you are out rule!  If you have questions regarding this or other events, please contact the event host Dave Cervini at[masked] or e-mail [masked].

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!

Hugs, Kisses, and bloody gladiator high-fives

- Yeti Michael

results.description:
We have had some local players tell us the field is usually empty these nights. The parks dept refuses to give us a permit for the time. I am willing to try and see if we can get the games in on the off weeks until the Winter Season starts on 12/5, when we have the permit for every Saturday.

Please remember we have no permit. I will hold the game and hope for the best. Their will be no payment for this game.

Same Rules Apply

Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Casual but grueling games. We are all here to have fun, which means no slide tackling :). Want to keep it as co-ed as possible. If you are completely new to soccer, come join, just let us know.

**** NEW RULE **** - Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait.list if they show up.

(1) Keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side. We will rotate new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot. No-Shows will be banned from the group.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• Attendance will now be taken by myself personally when handing out the bibs. If you are a NO SHOW, you will be removed from the group and banned permanently. 99% of you have smart phones and can cancel their RSVP within 2-3 hours giving anyone on the wait list the chance to come and play.

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.
results.name: Full-Field Soccer - Co-ed - 11 v 11 - No Permit - But Empty Field

results.description:
We were looking for an excuse to party and then we realized we didnt need one!

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=3YsSxHqBOZI&feature=youtu.be

If you like to drink, if you like to dance all with the option of stuffing your face time to time, then join us at Montana's Trail House this Saturday for a night of dancing and debauchery(the legal kind) !

Mama Beatz will be behind the decks spinning Hip Hop & Electro w/ a dash of Funk all night!

soundcloud.com/mamabeatz

NO COVER for group members! ;)
results.name: Dance, Dance, Dance!!!

results.description:
Super Smash bros (WII U) on SATURDAY NIGHT at Action Burger.  Bring your friends, bring your custom controller, eat some good food and have some fun on a SATURDAY NIGHT in Williamsburg Brooklyn. On the second tv will be either Anime, Blind date marathon or another Smash Bros, depending on how many people show up. 

https://youtu.be/Q_4eQZepbPk

Optional $30 open bar for 3 hours (11pm-2am) includes:


Open bar Drinks:Unlimited 16oz:  Black Island ice tea, Chocolate mint, Sex on the beach, Watermelon paradise, Action Peach fuzz, Peach ale Martini, Orange Waves, Coconut splash, Raspberry ale, Rum & Coke, Vodka & orange juice, Cranberry & Vodka. Selter & Vodka, Selter & Gin, Ginger Ale & Vodka, Ginger Ale & Tequila, Coke & Whiskey, diet Pepsi & Tequila, pineapple juice & Vodka, pineapple & Rum. 

Unlimited shots (Rum, Tequila, Vodka, Scotch).

* Smashbros tournaments coming soon.
results.how_to_find_us: 3 blocks from the Graham ave L train station in Williamsburg.

results.description:
Weekly Super Smash Bros battles at Action Burger on the WII U.
Do you have the skills to battle against the best? Gather your friends and prepare yourselves for future Smash Bros Tournaments. 

Latest Smash Bros battles at Action Burger on youtube video:


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Q_4eQZepbPk

RSVP members please purchase food or drinks (liquor) at the restaurant, to keep these meetups free.
_____________________________________________
OPTIONAL $30 open bar for 3 hours for meetup group:

______________________________________________

See you there.

results.description:
Come and dance your ass off at THE GRAND OPENING of EASTLANDS BAR!!

53 Wilson Ave. Brooklyn (Bushwick), NY (btw Melrose & Jefferson)


Have you seen DJ Mak-Len in action at The Skinny Bar/Lounge in the LES?

Yes/No....?

He brings his aggressive mixing style to Bushwick in this one night only event that is guaranteed to kill! Dance floor will be massacred and many hipster's will be caught in the crossfire!


 90'S Hip-Hop and R&B, House, EDM, 80s Soul/Funk & more!

See you there!!!!!!!!
results.name: DJ MAK-LEN's DANCE HARDER!! (Bushwick Hipster Massacre Edition)

results.description:
Friends,

Join us for our Saturday Night Social Mixer@ Slate NYC. We always have a fun time at that venue.

The group will meet at the bottom section of the venue from 10:15pm. Please note that at some point of the night we will make our way upstairs.

Get to meet many members from the group, as well as members from our other groups.

We will be situated at the right side of the bottom bar.

Admission is free for this event. Just mention Rory's List to the door person.

There will be mingling , drinking , dancing, and more that evening.

You are always welcome to invite your family, friends classmates and colleagues.

This is a multi Meetup group event.

Dress code is business casual.

We look forward in having a fun evening.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Rory

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
